events.title: Labor group urges Albanese to rescind invitation to Israeli president Isaac Herzog
events.description: Friends of Palestine has criticised the decision to invite Israel’s head of state to Australia in a sign of further strain within the Labor movement Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast A group of rank-and-file Labor party members has urged the Albanese government to rescind its invitation for the Israeli president, Isaac Herzog, to visit Australia, voicing outrage over his country’s military bombardment of Gaza. In signs of further strain inside the Labor movement over the war in the Middle East and the response to the alleged antisemitic terror attack at Bondi beach, the Labor Friends of Palestine group said that, if Herzog does travel to Australia, federal police should investigate him for his role in what they alleged was incitement of genocide – an outcome international law experts say is unlikely to occur. Continue reading...

events.title: Pakistan warns that Afghanistan is becoming 'hub for terrorists' and poses regional threat
events.description: Pakistan's military is warning that Afghanistan is becoming a “hub for terrorists.”

events.title: Security Council LIVE: ‘The power of the law must prevail’ amid Venezuela crisis, says Guterres
events.description: The Security Council met in emergency session in New York to address the US rendition of Venezuela’s President Nicolás Maduro from Caracas, a move that has sent shockwaves through the region and beyond. The UN chief António Guterres told ambassadors there must be respect for national sovereignty, “political independence and territorial integrity,” after warning on Saturday that the US had set a “dangerous precedent” for the world order. Follow the historic meeting live below from the UN Meetings Coverage team, and UN News app users can click here.

events.title: Anthony Joshua’s driver charged with dangerous driving after fatal crash in Nigeria
events.description: British boxer was injured in collision that killed his personal trainer Latif Ayodele and strength coach Sina Ghami Nigerian police have charged Anthony Joshua’s driver with causing death by dangerous driving after a fatal crash that killed two people. Adeniyi Mobolaji Kayode, 46, was also charged with driving without a valid driving licence and “driving without due care and attention, causing bodily harm and damage to property”. He is due to appear in court on 20 January. Continue reading...

events.title: Drop draft proposals on death penalty for Palestinians, UN rights chief urges Israel
events.description: The UN’s top human rights official on Friday called on Israeli authorities to abandon plans for new legislation that would impose mandatory death sentences exclusively on Palestinians, warning the proposals violate international law and fundamental human rights standards.

events.title: Trump claims Venezuela is set for an oil boom after US attack – history points to a bumpy road ahead
events.description: From Venezuela to Libya to Iraq, removal of dictators has not always guaranteed a surge in oil production, data shows Hours after Nicolás Maduro was captured by US special forces in Venezuela and indicted on drugs, weapons and “narco-terrorism” charges, Donald Trump spoke extensively about his plans for something else entirely: oil . Venezuela’s oil reserves – reputedly the world’s largest – are set to be pumped by a parade of powerful US oil companies, according to the US president, most of whom have not operated in the country in decades. Continue reading...

events.title: PM attends funeral of Bondi victim – as it happened
events.description: This blog is now closed Melbourne hits 41C as Australia’s most severe heatwave in six years descends on south-eastern states Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast Minister says many in flood-hit areas in Queensland ‘in shock’ after losses Kristy McBain , the federal minister for emergency management, said it would take some time to determinate the full impact of widespread flooding in parts of Queensland , noting for many primary producers, it will be the second time they’ve suffered losses after similar flooding in 2019 . You know, there are some significant losses, and I think the big concern is that we still don’t know the total number of losses because, at this stage, we’ve still got water flowing. And with the forecast looking like there’ll be further rain, those numbers could increase. So it’s quite precarious here. And obviously, speaking to a number of those producers, they’re quite in shock, I think. And they thought 2019 was kind of a once-in-a-lifetime event where there were a number of losses. And unfortunately, for a number of them, it looks like there’ll be similar losses or more. So that’s quite concerning. Continue reading...

events.title: Iran on the brink as protesters move to take two cities, appeal to Trump
events.description: Iranian security forces attack hospital in Ilam province and fire tear gas at wounded protesters as nationwide demonstrations escalate across multiple cities.

events.title: Extreme flooding submerges Kosovo cities, villages
events.description: Emergency crews in Kosovo carried out a second day of evacuations after the region was devastated by floods.

events.title: Venezuela crisis: UN aid effort continues amid political upheaval
events.description: Venezuela’s political shock has sharpened global attention on a country already facing one of the world’s largest humanitarian and displacement crises. For the United Nations, the priority remains unchanged: protecting lives, sustaining basic services and supporting Venezuelans at home and across the region.

events.title: 'Breaking point'? Iranian protests reflect 'a multi-layered convergence of dissatisfaction'
events.description: Iran's top judge is warning protesters there would be "no leniency ⁠for those who help the enemy against the Islamic Republic", while accusing Israel and the US of pursuing hybrid methods to disrupt the country. Joining Genie Godula is Maziyar GHIABI, an Iran expert and Professor at the University of Exeter. He describes the protests as a "multi-layered convergence of dissatisfaction." Amid a devastating economic crisis, inequality and sociopolitical and cultural grievances, the regime is deemed disconnected from the youth, and everyday Iranians.

events.title: Brown University shooter confessed in videos to planning attack for long time, showed no remorse: DOJ
events.description: Federal prosecutors release video transcripts allegedly recorded by Brown University gunman who killed 2 students, showing no remorse for shooting.

events.title: Security forces clash with protesters in Iran's main market as death toll rises
events.description: The protest at the Grand Bazaar represented the latest signal that the demonstrations are likely to continue. Violence surrounding the protests has killed at least 36 people, activists abroad say.

events.title: Iran protests: UN warns against further bloodshed
events.description: As protests in the Iranian capital, Tehran – sparked by increasing economic hardship and a cost-of-living crisis – continued for a ninth day, the UN Secretary-General said he was “deeply saddened by the reported loss of life and injuries,” resulting from clashes between security forces and protesters.

events.title: Melbourne swelters through hottest day in six years as severe heatwave descends on Australia’s south-eastern states
events.description: Hot conditions for NSW, Victoria, South Australia, the ACT, Tasmania and WA as authorities warn of high fire danger Follow our Australia news live blog for latest updates Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast Melbourne has recorded 41C, the hottest day in six years, and Adelaide’s temperature has reached 43C as a heatwave not seen since the deadly black summer bushfires has caused “really dangerous” conditions and bushfire warnings in several states. Severe to extreme intensity heatwaves stretched from the north-west to the south-east of the country – developing in Western Australia and moving through SA, Victoria, New South Wales, the ACT and Tasmania. Continue reading...

events.title: World News in Brief: Storms in Syria, school attacks in Nigeria, strikes continue in southern Lebanon
events.description: Thousands of displaced people in northern Syria are struggling to cope with freezing conditions after a severe snowstorm struck dozens of displacement sites, the UN aid coordination office (OCHA) said on Tuesday.

events.title: Uvalde trial halted after key witness changes testimony
events.description: Uvalde shooting trial halted after key witness reportedly changes testimony about officer's location during 2022 attack that killed 21 at Robb Elementary.

events.title: Colombian President Petro threatens military response after Trump warns Colombia may be next target
events.description: Colombian President Gustavo Petro said Monday he would "take up arms" against the U.S. if it attacks his country. This after President Trump suggested Petro could be his next target.

events.title: From Guatemala to Panama: US interventions in Latin America
events.description: The US attack on Venezuela is part of a long history of military interventions and political influence by the US in Latin America. Here are five such examples since World War II.

events.title: Nepalese mountaineer on the risks and rewards of climbing the world's highest peaks
events.description: In October 2024, when he was just 18 years old, Nima Rinji Sherpa became the youngest person to climb all 14 of the world's 8,000-metre peaks. It's valuable experience that now means he feels "confident" when "going to the mountains", even if there are risks "every time". Speaking to FRANCE 24, Nima Rinji Sherpa says he has witnessed death multiple times while climbing, adding that mountaineers need to stay calm and make "good decisions".

events.title: Iranian military leader threatens preemptive attack after Trump comments
events.description: Iran army chief threatens preemptive military action after President Donald Trump warned the U.S. is "locked and loaded" if the regime kills protesters.

events.title: ‘Anywhere in the world’: US seizes Venezuela-linked Russian oil tanker
events.description: Russia says US seizure of the Marinera vessel in North Atlantic constitutes violation of international maritime law.

events.title: US seizes Russian-flagged oil tanker in Atlantic after two-week pursuit
events.description: US coastguard reportedly boards the Marinera, facing no resistance but risking confrontation with Moscow Europe live – latest updates The US has seized a Russian-flagged oil tanker in the Atlantic Ocean in a high-stakes operation that could risk confrontation with the Kremlin after Moscow reportedly dispatched a submarine to safeguard the vessel. The Marinera, formerly known as the Bella 1, “was seized in the North Atlantic pursuant to a warrant issued by a US federal court after being tracked by USCGC Munro”, US European Command said in a post on X. US media reported that the country’s coastguard had successfully boarded the oil tanker, facing no resistance. Continue reading...

events.title: Greetings from a Paris park, where a lone sequoia tree is a marvel to behold
events.description: Far-Flung Postcards is a weekly series in which NPR's international team shares moments from their lives and work around the world.

events.title: Maduro's capture sparks African debate
events.description: African leaders weigh sovereignty, international law and strategic interests after the US seized Venezuela's leader Nicolas Maduro and flew him out of the country.

events.title: Maduro's capture in Venezuela sends warning signal to Iran
events.description: The capture of Venezuelan leader Nicolas Maduro is being closely watched in Tehran. Iran fears US military action in the Middle East, as nationwide protests continue to pressure the regime.

events.title: Trump’s attack leaves China worried about its interests in Venezuela | Amy Hawkins
events.description: Maduro had just affirmed ‘strong bonds of brotherhood’ with Beijing when US made its shocking intervention Venezuela crisis – latest updates Hours before his life and the fate of his country was changed dramatically, Venezuela’s leader, Nicolás Maduro, was exchanging smiles and handshakes with a Chinese delegation in the presidential palace in Caracas. On Friday evening, shortly before he was seized by US forces , Maduro wrote on Telegram of his meeting with China’s special envoy for Latin American affairs, Qiu Xiaoqi: “A fraternal meeting that reaffirms the strong bonds of brotherhood and friendship between China and Venezuela. Through thick and thin!” Continue reading...

events.title: Australia’s cost of living ‘getting crazier’ as nearly half of lower-income families worry about affording school shoes
events.description: Nine in 10 families are worried about price of back-to-school essentials as inflation continues to bite, research has found Follow our Australia news live blog for latest updates Budgeting for Laura, a single mother of four, often means deciding between buying enough food or paying her electricity bill on time. “Some weeks we’re good, some weeks we’re down and I have to go into the community and ask for vouchers,” she says. The down weeks have been happening more since the pandemic. Continue reading...

events.title: Families shocked Swiss ski bar was not inspected for years before deadly fire
events.description: The New Year's Eve fire at a bar in Crans-Montana killed 40 people and injured 116.

events.title: Cuba releases details of 32 officers killed in US strike on Venezuela as US defends attack
events.description: The Cuban government has revealed the identities of 32 military personnel killed during the U.S. capture of Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro

events.title: Iran offers citizens $7 monthly payments as protests spiral over economic crisis: report
events.description: Iran shifts from import subsidies to direct $7 monthly payments for citizens as the currency loses its value and protests intensify nationwide, according to reports.

events.title: Saudi-led coalition attacks south Yemen separatists
events.description: Video shows explosions at an arms storage facility in southern Yemen.

events.title: US makes big commitment to Ukraine peace deal – but one man is missing from talks
events.description: Although not to be underplayed, the Anglo-French commitment to put a multi-national force into Ukraine after a ceasefire was always on the table.

events.title: Iran army chief threatens preemptive attack over 'rhetoric' targeting country after Trump's comments
events.description: Iran’s army chief has threatened preemptive military action over the “rhetoric” targeting the Islamic Republic

events.title: Thirteen more lives lost in Sudan as 1,000th day of war looms
events.description: Thirteen more lives – including children – were reportedly lost on Tuesday in another drone attack on Sudan’s North Kordofan region.

events.title: Maduro seized, norms tested: Security Council divided as Venezuela crisis deepens
events.description: The UN Security Council met on Monday against a sharply altered diplomatic backdrop, following US strikes on the Venezuelan capital and seizure of President Nicolás Maduro.

events.title: Los Angeles Fire Department admits initial Palisades Fire report edited to protect leadership
events.description: LA fire chief admits Palisades Fire analysis was edited to protect department leadership from criticism in devastating California wildfire, report says.

events.title: Trump administration reportedly warns Maduro ally Diosdado Cabello could be next
events.description: Washington signals interior minister must back acting president, Delcy Rodríguez, or face Nicolás Maduro’s fate The Trump administration has reportedly put Venezuela’s hardline interior minister, Diosdado Cabello, on notice that he could be next to fall if he does not support the acting president, Delcy Rodríguez, who has been in power since the Nicolás Maduro was seized on Saturday. Reuters reported that US officials are “especially concerned” that Cabello – long seen by many as the regime’s real No 2 – could sabotage Washington’s plan to keep key figures from Maduro’s inner circle in place in the name of stability while pursuing a transition, and provide unrestricted access to Venezuela’s oil. Continue reading...

events.title: Venezuelan authorities detain more than a dozen international journalists
events.description: Venezuelan authorities detained more than a dozen international journalists Monday, a media advocacy group says. Most of them have since been released, but the move has members of the press concerned.

events.title: Buy or invade? Trump weighs options to take control of Greenland
events.description: US President Donald Trump says he is considering “a range of options” to acquire Greenland for national security reasons, with reports that the White House discussed scenarios including military action. Danish, Greenlandic and European leaders have firmly rejected the idea, stressing international law and insisting that Greenland is not for sale.

events.title: World News in Brief: Escalating violence in Sudan, civilian danger grows in Ukraine, Ethiopia aid cuts
events.description: In Sudan, civilians continue to bear the brunt of escalating violence, particularly in the Darfur and Kordofan regions.

events.title: Security Council: New faces, old tensions as five nations take their seats
events.description: From deploying peacekeepers to conducting quiet – but at times heated – diplomacy, the UN Security Council sits at the heart of global decision-making on war and peace. As of January, five new countries will have a seat around the iconic horseshoe table.

events.title: Top Canadian officials to visit Greenland amid international fears as Trump eyes NATO-linked territory
events.description: Canadian leaders reportedly plan Greenland visit in February amid growing international tensions over President Donald Trump's annexation comments.

events.title: Tensions between Saudis and Emiratis over future of Yemen reach boiling point
events.description: Dispute has potential to create civil war in south of Yemen and spill over into neighbouring countries Tensions between the United Arab Emirates and Saudi Arabia over the future of Yemen and the imminent possibility of the declaration of an independent southern state have reached boiling point with Saudi Arabia in effect accusing the UAE of threatening its future security. The dispute has the potential to create a civil war within the south of Yemen and also spill over into other disputes including in Sudan and the Horn of Africa where the two countries often find themselves backing opposite sides. Yemen could yet become only one theatre in which the two vastly wealthy Gulf states vie for political influence, control of shipping lanes and commercial access. Continue reading...

events.title: Why Russia has kept quiet over Maduro's ouster in Venezuela
events.description: Russia sent bombers to Venezuela to support Maduro not too long ago, but now the Kremlin has stood by and watched as the US arrested the disputed leader. What does the US surprise attack mean for the war in Ukraine?

events.title: Former NATO envoy says Trump still committed to Ukraine
events.description: Kurt Volker said Trump wants a quick end to the war, but the conflict continues because Russia's Putin believes he can still prevail.

events.title: 'Donroe Doctrine': 'Kidnapping of Maduro had nothing to do with democracy, human rights'
events.description: Brazilian award-winning author and European correspondent Jamil Chade offers deep perspective on Trump's dramatic attack on Venezuela and ensuing abduction of Nicolás Maduro. He argues this has very little to do with democracy or human rights and is more about US strategic interests in Latin America and Venezuela’s vast natural resources. His analysis challenges dominant narratives and evokes a return to the brutal Cold War‑era interventionism in the Americas during the 1950's, '60's and '70's.

events.title: After Maduro, Venezuela power vacuum exposes brutal insiders and enforcers
events.description: Venezuela faces deeper chaos after Maduro's fall as experts warn fractured regime could unleash more brutal violence and repression than under former president's rule.

events.title: Syrian army closes Aleppo’s Kurdish areas as clashes persist
events.description: Violence follows collapse of talks aimed at absorption of semiautonomous Kurdish forces by state institutions.

events.title: They bought an abandoned 'ghost house' in the Japanese countryside
events.description: He'd spent years backpacking around the world, and Japanese traveler Daisuke Kajiyama was finally ready to return home to pursue his long-held dream of opening up a guesthouse.

events.title: Venezuela to continue supplying oil to US ‘indefinitely’, White House says
events.description: US to remove some sanctions to allow it to keep selling country’s supplies after laying claim to blockaded crude US seizes Russian-flagged oil tanker after two-week pursuit Explainer: why so much interest in a rusty tanker in the Atlantic? The US plans to control Venezuela’s oil sales “indefinitely” after laying claim to 50m barrels of blockaded crude and seizing a Russian oil tanker linked to the South American country. The White House already plans to sell up to $3bn (£2.2bn) worth of Venezuelan crude stranded in tankers and storage facilities into the oversupplied global market after the American military’s capture of Nicolás Maduro . Continue reading...

events.title: Germany news: Power back in Berlin after arson attack
events.description: Berlin officials say power has been restored in the southwest of the city after an act of "sabotage" caused a major blackout. Federal prosecutors are investigating a left-wing extremist group. DW has more

events.title: UK, France strike new Ukraine security pact as US takes lead in ceasefire enforcement
events.description: Coalition of the Willing signs Ukraine security agreement with U.S. support, establishing multinational force and ceasefire monitoring mechanism.

events.title: What does the US raid in Venezuela mean for China’s designs on Taiwan?
events.description: Perception that Chinese-made weapons could not stop a ‘decapitation strike’ may give Beijing pause for thought The sight of a hostile regional superpower launching an overnight raid to depose the leader of a smaller neighbouring country could easily have sent pulses in Taiwan racing. The US on Saturday revealed the details of a surprise raid to capture Venezuela’s leader, Nicolás Maduro , who was whisked away to the US, where he was frogmarched into a court in New York on Monday . Continue reading...

events.title: Yemen aid response buckling under funding cuts as needs keep rising
events.description: Yemen’s already fragile humanitarian response is being pushed to breaking point by deep funding shortfalls, the UN warned in an update Sunday highlighting mounting risks for millions across the country.

events.title: ‘Do not give up on children’: Displaced by violence, a Haitian girl finds hope at school
events.description: A teenage Haitian girl who was forced to flee her home in Haiti’s capital, Port-au-Prince, due to gang violence has urged adults not to “give up on children.”

events.title: Why are people protesting in Iran? Everything you need to know
events.description: Protests sparked by a widening economic crisis have swept across Iran for more than a week.

events.title: There's an uncomfortable truth behind Trump's Greenland grab
events.description: It is becoming increasingly clear that Donald Trump is serious about taking Greenland from Denmark, a NATO ally, despite warnings that such a move would destroy the alliance.

events.title: Protest-hit Iran warily watches the US after its raid on Venezuela
events.description: As Iran is gripped by new protests, many people there are focused on the U.S. raid in Venezuela and wonder whether the same could occur in Tehran

events.title: Maduro arrest sends 'clear message' to drug cartels, allies and US rivals, retired admiral says
events.description: Maduro's takedown sends deterrent message to cartels and U.S. rivals, potentially altering global power dynamics as experts predict regional cooperation.

events.title: Iranian protesters rename Tehran street after Trump, plead 'don't let them kill us' amid crackdown
events.description: Iranian protesters appeal to President Donald Trump amid nationwide demonstrations against the regime, with reports of deadly crackdowns and arrests across cities.

events.title: Iran protesters emboldened by Trump admin’s Persian messaging after Obama-Biden inaction, activists say
events.description: U.S. shifts Iran policy as Trump administration revives aggressive messaging toward Tehran, contrasting sharply with previous diplomatic approaches.

events.title: Trump Greenland takeover would end NATO, Denmark asserts
events.description: Danish Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen warns that President Donald Trump's Greenland annexation threats could end NATO, saying military action against ally would stop security alliance formed after WWII.

events.title: Japan nuclear agency worker loses phone with confidential data in China
events.description: Authorities cannot say whether data was leaked from the device, which was lost at a Shanghai airport.

events.title: These were the best and worst places for air quality in 2021, new report shows
events.description: Air pollution spiked to unhealthy levels around the world in 2021, according to a new report.

events.title: Anger in Papua New Guinea after Starlink ordered to shut down internet services
events.description: In mid-December PNG said the company did not have a licence to operate in the country and ordered it to halt operations Frustration is growing in Papua New Guinea weeks after the government ordered Starlink to shut down operations in the country as businesses, health providers and communities struggle without access to internet services. Starlink, owned by Elon Musk’s SpaceX, is a satellite internet company that provides internet to remote places. In mid-December, the National Information and Communications Technology Authority (Nicta) ordered the company to halt operations because it was not licensed in PNG. Continue reading...

events.title: South Korea's Lee asks Xi to play 'mediator' role with North
events.description: After talks earlier this week, South Korea's president, Lee Jae Myung, said he asked Chinese President Xi Jinping to help limit Pyongyang's nuclear program.

events.title: Trump admin cuts federal funding for child care in 5 states
events.description: The US health department announced it was going to freeze federal funding for certain programs for needy families citing fraud concerns. The administration zeroed in on Minnesota last week after an unproven viral video.

events.title: US Congress divided over Maduro capture and future of US in Venezuela
events.description: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio briefed leaders in Congress late January 5 on the striking military operation in Venezuela, amid mounting concerns that President Donald Trump is embarking on a new era of U.S. expansionism without consultation with lawmakers. After the briefing, Republican House Speaker Mike Johnson emphasised that U.S. actions in Venezuela are “not a regime change” operation... but democratic leaders said the Trump administration lacked a clear plan for running the country.

events.title: Watchdog halts nuclear plant safety review after seismic data found to be fabricated
events.description: Japan's nuclear watchdog is scrapping the safety screening for two reactors at the Hamaoka nuclear power plant

events.title: A woman dies from cervical cancer every two minutes, UN says
events.description: A flood of questions drowned Jeanette in thought after she was diagnosed with cervical cancer. Would she be unable to conceive a child? Would she have to enter menopause at the early age of 31?

events.title: NYC sex offender indicted for threatening to kill Jews, police and federal officials
events.description: A New York City man accused of posting threats on social media targeting Jews, police officers and federal officials faces hate crime charges.

events.title: Man with machete shot and killed by police, who then find 3 more dead inside home: officials
events.description: Police shot and killed a man armed with a knife in the Garden State on Monday, the New Jersey state attorney general's office announced.

events.title: Do Russia and China pose a national security threat to the US in Greenland?
events.description: White House says President Donald Trump still wants to buy Greenland, but has said military means are an option, too.

events.title: Warner Bros rejects Paramount takeover again and tells shareholders to stick with Netflix bid
events.description: Warner’s leadership has rebuffed Paramount’s overtures again and urged shareholders to back the sale of its streaming and studio business to Netflix for $72 billion. Warner expressed concerns that the Paramount bid would essentially be a leveraged buyout, which includes a lot of debt. A merger with either company could take over a year to close — and will attract tremendous antitrust scrutiny along the way. FRANCE 24's Yuka Royer takes a look.

events.title: US takeover of Greenland would 'simply mean the end of NATO', says Denmark
events.description: US President Donald Trump is discussing options including military action to take control of Greenland, the White House said on January 7, upping tensions that Denmark warns could destroy the NATO alliance. Denmark has warned any move to take Greenland by force would mean "everything would stop," including NATO and 80 years of close transatlantic security links. FRANCE 24's Clovis Casali looks into the issue for us.

events.title: California mom says ChatGPT coached teen son on drug use before his fatal overdose: report
events.description: A California mother says her teen son used a chatbot for drug-related questions over several months before dying from an overdose.

events.title: Refugees return to ruined Nigerian town despite threats from armed groups
events.description: 'We must live, we must hope', say returnees who were displaced for a decade from homes in Malam Fatori, Borno State.

events.title: The surreal facades of America's strip clubs
events.description: Some people travel the world in search of adventure, while others seek out natural wonders, cultural landmarks or culinary experiences. But French photographer François Prost was looking for something altogether different during his recent road trip across America: strip clubs.

events.title: Cremation pyre in Africa thought to be world’s oldest containing adult remains
events.description: 9,500-year-old pyre uncovered in Malawi offers rare insight into rituals of ancient African hunter-gatherer groups A cremation pyre built about 9,500 years ago has been discovered in Africa, offering a fresh glimpse into the complexity of ancient hunter-gatherer communities. Researchers say the pyre, discovered in a rock shelter at the foot of Mount Hora in northern Malawi, is thought to be the oldest in the world to contain adult remains, the oldest confirmed intentional cremation in Africa, and the first pyre to be associated with African hunter-gatherers. Continue reading...

events.title: The world has too much oil right now. Will companies want Venezuela's?
events.description: Crude prices are low. Companies are being cautious. But huge reserves — particularly of the heavy, viscous oil Venezuela has in abundance — remain appealing.

events.title: Taking over Greenland, a long-standing US obsession
events.description: Days after US forces captured Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro in Caracas, US President Donald Trump suggested that other regions of the world could be on Washington’s radar, including Greenland. Ever since his first term, the billionaire has repeatedly expressed interest in the mineral-rich Danish autonomous territory in the Arctic – a focus that predates Trump’s presidency.

events.title: Backlash erupts after city council appoints police review board member with murder conviction
events.description: Salem councilors face union pressure to reverse vote keeping convicted killer Kyle Hedquist on police oversight board after missing background check.

events.title: Pope Leo calls for Christians to treat foreigners with kindness as he closes Catholic Holy Year
events.description: Pope Leo XIV closed the Catholic Church's Holy Year by calling on Christians around the world to help those in need and treat foreigners with kindness.

events.title: Berlin power outage highlights German vulnerability to sabotage
events.description: The power cut was caused by a suspected arson attack and came as temperatures dipped below freezing.

events.title: Thousands of refugees fleeing DR Congo arrive at Burundi camps
events.description: Tens of thousands of people have crossed into Burundi to escape violence in the eastern DRC.

events.title: Retail spending fell in March as consumers pull back
events.description: Spending at US retailers fell in March as consumers pulled back amid recessionary fears fueled by the banking crisis.

events.title: Maduro's downfall deals China new cards in US rivalry
events.description: Beijing is "deeply shocked" by the Trump administration's attack on Venezuela, one of China's key partners in Latin America. At the same time, China can find ways to use the kidnapping of Maduro for its own agenda.

events.title: France working with allies on plan should US move on Greenland
events.description: France is working with partners on a plan on how to respond should the United States act ⁠on its threat to take over Greenland, a minister said on January 7, as Europe sought to address U.S. President Donald Trump's ambitions in the region. This comes as the White House has said that it is looking at buying the territory, and that military action is possible. FRANCE 24's Philip Turle breaks it down for us.

events.title: Is there a link between the military escalation in Aleppo and the diplomatic breakthroughs in Paris?
events.description: The Syrian government and Kurdish-led forces traded blame over who started the deadly clashes on January 6, in which at least nine people were killed. A curfew has been imposed, and schools, universities and government buildings remained closed. This comes after a rare meeting in Paris between Syrian and Israeli representatives, with both seeking military de-escalation. FRANCE 24's Wassim Nasr breaks it down for us.

events.title: Why does Donald Trump want to take over Greenland?
events.description: Denmark and Greenland are seeking a meeting with U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio after the Trump administration doubled down on its intention to take over the strategic Arctic island, a self-governing Danish territory. Tensions escalated after the White House said Tuesday that the “U.S. military is always an option,” even as a series of European leaders rejected President Donald Trump’s renewed demands. FRANCE 24's Philip Turle looks into how serious these threats could be.

events.title: Why does Trump want to take over Greenland - and could he actually do it?
events.description: Donald Trump has warned he is "very serious" about annexing Greenland – and has not ruled out taking the territory by force.

events.title: Drones, fear and exhaustion: The daily reality of providing aid to Ukraine
events.description: Almost four years since Russia’s full-scale invasion of Ukraine, aid teams continue to adapt to the lethal reality of working in a modern war zone.

events.title: UN agency rolls out three-year plan to safeguard Ukraine’s bread basket
events.description: Ukraine’s agricultural sector remains under intense pressure as the war continues to disrupt food production and endanger civilians, the UN food security agency warned on Tuesday, as it unveiled a new three-year plan to help farmers survive and protect their livelihoods.

events.title: ICE involved in Minnesota shooting, vehicle ramming incident: DHS
events.description: Gov. Tim Walz responds to ICE-involved shooting in Minneapolis, urging calm as officials gather information about the developing incident.

events.title: Man drops engagement ring from 118-foot bridge during proposal, but there's a happy ending
events.description: Christmas lights proposal at Boyne Mountain becomes unforgettable rescue mission when couple and resort staff search for dropped engagement ring.

events.title: Massive luxury handbag heist caught on camera as heavily armed police swarm California store
events.description: California police arrest two suspects allegedly caught on surveillance camera stealing $100,000 in luxury handbags from Irvine store in early morning raid.

events.title: Father arrested on drug, weapons charges as 4-year-old son found dead after New Year's disappearance
events.description: Father arrested on felony charges during search for missing 4-year-old son who died after disappearing in Alabama. Jameson Boley allegedly exposed kids to drugs.

events.title: Cuba identifies 32 military personnel killed in US operation against Maduro regime in Venezuela
events.description: Havana says 32 members of its armed forces died during a U.S. military operation to capture Nicolás Maduro, calling it an act of aggression.

events.title: Venezuela's new interim leader Delcy Rodríguez 'hates the West,' ex official warns
events.description: Venezuela's new interim president Delcy Rodríguez represents continuity of Maduro's regime, according to a former official as the 56-year-old faces U.S. sanctions.

events.title: Germany: Local governments face financial collapse
events.description: Many cities and municipalities in Germany are facing bankruptcy and no longer know how they're supposed to fulfill their responsibilities. They are blaming the federal government.

events.title: Snow, ice disrupt travel across western Europe
events.description: A cold snap has grounded hundreds of flights in Amsterdam and Paris. Bus services were also suspended in the French capital, where locals grabbed skis and sledges to enjoy the rare heavy snow.

events.title: Paris neighbourhoods: Exploring the residential 15th arrondissement
events.description: In this edition of French Connections, Genie Godula and Florence Villeminot continue their tour of Paris with a stop in the French capital's most populated arrondissement: the 15th. Located in the southwestern corner of the capital, the 15th doesn't boast a lot of tourist attractions. In fact, Parisians love to joke that this residential and family-friendly arrondissement is the capital's most boring. But while it might not be as exciting or flashy as other parts of town, it's a great place to get a taste of real, everyday Paris and discover some hidden gems. We take you on a tour.

events.title: US says it will discuss Greenland ownership with Denmark next week
events.description: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio announces talks amid concerns over US claims to the Danish territory.

events.title: Rare mountain gorilla twins born in Africa's oldest national park
events.description: Trackers in DR Congo's Virunga National Park spotted the babies being hugged by their mother on Saturday.

events.title: Trump says Venezuela will be 'turning over' up to 50 million barrels of oil to US
events.description: Earlier the president said US oil firms could be "up and running" in the country within 18 months.

events.title: Silicon Valley Bank collapse renews calls to address disparities impacting entrepreneurs of color
events.description: When customers at Silicon Valley Bank rushed to withdraw billions of dollars last month, venture capitalist Arlan Hamilton stepped in to help some of the founders of color who panicked about losing access to payroll funds.

events.title: Guinea’s junta chief elected president after opposition boycott
events.description: Mamady Doumbouya reneged on promise not to stand and hand west African country back to civilian rule The head of Guinea’s junta, Mamady Doumbouya, who had pledged not to run for office after seizing power four years ago, has been elected president after the country’s electoral commission said he had secured a sweeping majority of the vote. Doumbouya, 41, faced eight rivals for the presidency but the main opposition leaders were barred from running and had urged a boycott of the vote held over the weekend. Continue reading...

events.title: Boat and engine supplier who 'made millions' off migrant crossings jailed
events.description: A Turkish national has been jailed for 11 years after being found guilty of supplying thousands of small boats and engines used by people smugglers to transport asylum seekers across the English Channel.

events.title: Venezuela’s people must be heard, insists UN human rights chief
events.description: Responding to the seizure of Venezuela President Nicolás Maduro by the United States, UN human rights chief Volker Türk on Tuesday reiterated deep concerns that the military operation undermined fundamental protections for sovereign countries.

events.title: UN chief deeply concerned over ‘possible intensification of instability’ in Venezuela
events.description: Invoking the bedrock principle prohibiting the use of force against the territory and independence of any State, the UN Secretary-General told the Security Council on Monday there must be “full respect” for the UN Charter, in the face of the United States military intervention in Venezuela and seizure of President Nicolás Maduro.

events.title: Wisconsin judge convicted of obstructing ICE resigns, vows to keep fighting case
events.description: A Milwaukee judge convicted of obstructing federal immigration agents has resigned while vowing to continue fighting her case.

events.title: Venezuelan ‘dark fleet’ tanker evades US Coast Guard as Russia sends submarine to escort vessel: reports
events.description: Russia formally asked the United States to halt pursuit of Venezuelan oil tanker Marinera after the vessel escaped U.S. Coast Guard interception in the Caribbean.

events.title: Israel and Syria resume diplomatic dialogue after months of silence under US mediation
events.description: Israel and Syria reportedly resume diplomatic talks with U.S. backing under Trump's Middle East peace vision, focusing on border security and regional stability.

events.title: Yemen separatist leader accused of treason as Saudi Arabia strikes forces
events.description: The presidency also expels Aidarous al-Zubaidi, head of the UAE-backed Southern Transitional Council, after he fails to fly to Riyadh for talks.

events.title: The painful questions for Nato and the EU as Trump threatens Greenland
events.description: The White House has said that 'utilising the ‌US military is ‍always an option at the commander-in-chief's disposal'

events.title: US ‘adapt, shrink or die’ terms for $2bn aid pot will mean UN bowing down to Washington, say experts
events.description: Afghanistan and Yemen excluded from list of 17 priority countries chosen by Trump administration to receive aid laden with demands The $2bn (£1.5bn) of aid the US pledged this week may have been hailed as “bold and ambitious” by the UN but could be the “nail in the coffin” in changing to a shrunken, less flexible aid system dominated by Washington’s political priorities, aid experts fear. After a year of deep cuts in aid budgets by the US and European countries, the announcement of new money for the humanitarian system is a source of some relief, but experts are deeply concerned about demands that the US has imposed on how the money should be managed and where it can go. Continue reading...

events.title: Highly transmissible flu strain infects more than 2,500 Australians
events.description: Unseasonably high rate of influenza, dubbed Super-K, comes as vaccination rates plummet among those most vulnerable, GPs say Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast More than 2,500 Australians have rung in the new year with a highly transmissible new strain of influenza, and health authorities are on alert for what could be Australia’s worst year since tracking began 35 years ago. Last year’s record, when more than half a million Australians contracted a laboratory-certified form of flu and 1,508 people died , was a 44% increase on the 2024 mortality rate. Continue reading...

events.title: Iran: More than 2,000 protesters arrested, rights group says
events.description: Protests sparked by economic hardship have spread across Iran, in the biggest wave of dissent in three years.

events.title: Saudi-led coalition strikes Yemen after STC leader ousted
events.description: The air strikes come amid a deepening rift between Saudi Arabia and UAE, which backs forces fighting Houthi rebels in Yemen.

events.title: There's a sense in Greenland that Trump really will take over
events.description: Greenland is in the eye of an intense diplomatic storm, not that you would know it being here.

events.title: China announces another new trade measure against Japan as tensions rise
events.description: China has escalated its trade tensions with Japan by launching an investigation into imported dichlorosilane, a chemical gas used in making semiconductors

events.title: Snow and ice wreak havoc across Europe, causing deadly accidents and travel chaos
events.description: Snow, ice and freezing temperatures have hit parts of Europe, causing chaos

events.title: Family of Malaysian ex-leader Mahathir says broken hip serious but not life-threatening
events.description: Former Malaysian Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad is recovering from a broken right hip after a fall

events.title: Canada's Indigenous governor general to visit Greenland as Trump renews talk of annexing it
events.description: Prime Minister Mark Carney says his foreign minister and the governor general will visit Greenland in early February in the wake of renewed threats by U.S. President Donald Trump to annex the Danish territory

events.title: Winter storms upended thousands in Gaza
events.description: Some 65,000 households in the Gaza Strip were affected by the severe winter storms that whipped through the enclave last month, the UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) said on Tuesday.

events.title: Gaza aid lifelines under strain as winter worsens
events.description: Humanitarian partners in the Gaza Strip are struggling to reach hundreds of thousands of vulnerable people as winter storms batter damaged homes and temporary shelters.

events.title: An Indian state wants to tackle hate speech with a law - can it work?
events.description: Karnataka has passed a bill to prevent hate speech and hate crimes but critics say it could erode civil liberties.

events.title: New video said to show US forces shadowing Russian oil tanker
events.description: Video released by Russian state media is said to show a US coast guard vessel shadowing a Russian-flagged oil tanker.

events.title: LIVE: Syria to launch military operation against SDF in Aleppo
events.description: The Syrian army has declared Aleppo’s Kurdish areas 'closed military zones' and ordered civilians to leave.

events.title: Not only is Lake Powell's water level plummeting because of drought, its total capacity is shrinking, too
events.description: Lake Powell, the second-largest human-made reservoir in the US, has lost nearly 7% of its potential storage capacity since 1963, when Glen Canyon Dam was built, a new report shows.

events.title: Weather tracker: Arctic air grips Europe as severe winds batter Corsica
events.description: Subzero temperatures, heavy snowfall and powerful gusts mark a harsh start to 2026 for many It has been a cold start to the year across much of Europe, particularly in central regions, where temperatures dropped to double-digit negatives. Heavy snowfall hit parts of eastern and central Europe on New Year’s Eve, notably in Poland and Ukraine, with similar conditions across the Alps on the first few days of the year. The cold is likely to continue this week as an Arctic air mass sinks south across Europe, pulling temperatures well below the seasonal average outside south-east Europe. Temperatures are expected to fall widely by about 5C (41F) below average, with some areas – such as parts of central and north-eastern Europe – up to 10C lower than the norm. When wind chill is taken into account, it will feel even colder. Continue reading...

events.title: Trump weighs military option to take control of Greenland
events.description: The US president has argued that control of Greenland is a "strategic" necessity. Secretary of State Marco Rubio has tried to downplay Trump's rhetoric, emphasizing the preferred option would be to buy Greenland.

events.title: Venezuela cooperating on US-seized oil tankers, says Marco Rubio
events.description: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio and US Secretary of Defence Pete Hegseth have addressed journalists following the US army's seizure of two Venezuela-linked tanker and Donald Trump's reiterated remarks that the United States should take over Greenland, a territory that is part of the kingdom of Denmark. FRANCE 24's Philip Turle analyses their comments.

events.title: Replay: U.S. Secretaries of State and Defence address Venezuela, Greenland
events.description: Rewatch as U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio and U.S. Secretary of Defence Pete Hegseth journalists as the U.S. has reiterated demands to take over Greenland and seized two Venezuela-linked oil tankers.

events.title: Denmark, Greenland seek talks with Rubio after White House again says it wants island
events.description: Denmark and Greenland are seeking a meeting with U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio after the Trump administration reiterated its intention to take over Greenland

events.title: US actions in Venezuela ‘constitute a dangerous precedent’: Guterres
events.description: The UN Secretary-General António Guterres has said he is “deeply alarmed” over the standoff between the United States and Venezuela in recent months, which culminated on Saturday morning in the capture of President Nicolás Maduro by US special forces.

events.title: Latin America fractures over Trump’s Maduro capture as regional allies shift right
events.description: Latin American nations split over Venezuela's Maduro capture as regional summit fails to reach consensus, exposing a new shift to the right across the Western Hemisphere.

events.title: Al Jazeera reporter witnesses fighting in Aleppo as thousands flee
events.description: Fighting in Aleppo between the Syrian army and the Kurdish-led SDF has forced thousands of people to flee.

events.title: Ukraine reports ‘concrete results’ from talks with Western allies
events.description: Chief of staff Kyrylo Budanov says progress has been made at key Paris summit.

events.title: Look of the Week: Blackpink headline Coachella in Korean hanboks
events.description: Bringing the second day of this year's Coachella to a close, K-Pop girl group Blackpink made history Saturday night when they became the first Asian act to ever headline the festival. To a crowd of, reportedly, over 125,000 people, Jennie, Jisoo, Lisa and Rosé used the ground-breaking moment to pay homage to Korean heritage by arriving onstage in hanboks: a traditional type of dress.

events.title: How Playboy cut ties with Hugh Hefner to create a post-MeToo brand
events.description: Hugh Hefner launched Playboy Magazine 70 years ago this year. The first issue included a nude photograph of Marilyn Monroe, which he had purchased and published without her knowledge or consent.

events.title: Alarmed by Trump's comments, European leaders say Greenland 'belongs to its people'
events.description: European leaders who gathered in Paris Tuesday to discuss a security plan for Ukraine expressed their concerns about President Trump's comments on seeking an American takeover of Greenland.

events.title: Uganda election: Candidates, key issues and what to know
events.description: On January 15, Ugandans will elect a new president and members of parliament. DW breaks down presidential candidates, key issues and other facts you need to know ahead of the crucial vote.

events.title: US seizes two sanctioned Venezuela-linked oil tankers as blockade 'in full effect'
events.description: The U.S. has seized two sanctioned oil tankers linked to Venezuela in back-to-back actions in the North Atlantic and the Caribbean. This comes after US President Donald Trump announced that a deal had been struck with interim leader Delcy Rodriguez to send tens of millions of barrels of oil to the US. According to US media, Washington has also reportedly demanded that Caracas meet the White House's demands before being allowed to pump more oil, including exporting heavy crude oil exclusively to the US, and severe economic ties with Iran, China and Russia.

events.title: In Japan, organised crime finds new recruits online with 'yami baito'
events.description: A new type of criminal activity known as yami baito is spreading in Japan. The modus operandi is simple: online ads offer easy, well-paid jobs such as parcel deliveries. But behind these tasks lie illegal activities. Many young recruits end up involved in scams, burglaries or phone fraud. They're the new foot soldiers of a vast criminal network that often preys on vulnerable elderly people. Our correspondents report.

events.title: Yemen anti-Houthi council expels separatist leader and says he faces treason charges
events.description: A council fighting against Yemen’s Houthi rebels says it has expelled the leader of a separatist movement and charged him with treason after he reportedly declined to travel to Saudi Arabia for talks

events.title: Video shows masked thieves using sledgehammer in brazen Lululemon heist before fleeing in U-Haul
events.description: Surveillance video captured a brazen sledgehammer smash-and-grab at a Pennsylvania Lululemon store, and masked suspects reportedly stole over $5,000.

events.title: 911 call at Ohio dentist's home reported 'domestic dispute' months before he and wife found shot dead: records
events.description: Ohio dentist and wife found dead months after mysterious 911 call from same home about domestic dispute. Columbus police seek person of interest.

events.title: Attorney for suspect in Vance home vandalism rules out possible motivation
events.description: A defense attorney for the suspect accused of vandalizing JD Vance's Cincinnati home claims there was no political motivation, citing mental health issues.

events.title: Mobs of motorcycle-riding armed militia hunt Venezuelan streets for Trump supporters as crackdown intensifies
events.description: Venezuela crackdown intensifies as Diosdado Cabello leads paramilitary groups following Nicolás Maduro's reported capture, with armed colectivos conducting searches.

events.title: Thousands flee fighting in Syria’s Aleppo
events.description: Thousands of people have been fleeing their homes ahead of a curfew in the Syrian city of Aleppo.

events.title: Big-box stores could help slash emissions and save millions by putting solar panels on roofs. Why aren't more of them doing it?
events.description: As the US attempts to wean itself off its heavy reliance on fossil fuels and shift to cleaner energy sources, many experts are eyeing a promising solution: your neighborhood big-box stores and shopping malls.

events.title: Brigitte Bardot's funeral takes place as Saint-Tropez bids adieu to cinema icon
events.description: Brigitte Bardot's funeral was held on January 7 with a private service and a public homage in Saint-Tropez, the French Riviera resort where she lived for more than half a century after retiring from movie stardom at the height of her fame. Hundreds of people gathered in the small town to follow the farewell on large screens set up at the port and on two plazas.

events.title: Venezuela's interim leader sacks general in charge of Maduro's guard
events.description: General Javier Marcano Tábata was the commander of the inner circle of guards tasked with protecting Maduro.

events.title: Big freeze causes travel chaos across western Europe
events.description: More than 700 flights were cancelled at Amsterdam's Schiphol Airport alone on Wednesday.

events.title: Plot to kill Burkina Faso leader foiled, says junta
events.description: The security minister accuses neighbouring Ivory Coast of funding the plan to kill Capt Traoré.

events.title: Opposition leader Machado says her coalition should lead Venezuela
events.description: Donald Trump publicly dismissed the Nobel winner Machado, saying she did not have support and respect.

events.title: Zelensky says he does not have clear security pledge from allies
events.description: The comments come after the UK and France said they would deploy troops to Ukraine if a peace deal with Russia is agreed.

events.title: Nigeria's ex-justice minister granted bail in $6m corruption case
events.description: Abubakar Malami was one of the most influential figures in the administration of former President Buhari.

events.title: 'Fear in the streets': Venezuelans uncertain about what might happen next
events.description: The BBC spoke to Venezuelans after the seizure by US forces of Venezuelan leader Nicolás Maduro.

events.title: Trump's Venezuela raid has created chaos - and that is a risk for China
events.description: The US's seizure of Nicolás Maduro carries uncertainty for China, which is no fan of chaos.

events.title: Selfies and smiles: South Korea seeks 'new phase' in ties with China
events.description: South Korea's Lee Jae Myung snapped selfies with China's Xi Jinping as he pursues better ties with China in a four-day visit.

events.title: Watch: US seizes oil tanker in Caribbean sea
events.description: The US Coast Guard boarded two "ghost fleet" tanker ships in a "meticulously coordinated" operation, Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem said.

events.title: Watch: Trump says Maduro copied his dancing. Did he?
events.description: The US president on Tuesday claimed the ousted Venezuelan leader imitated his moves. Here's a side-by-side look at both men's dancing.

events.title: Trump says he wants to free up Venezuelan oil flow. What was blocking it?
events.description: Trump and Rubio say they want to use the oil to help Venezuelans. That's not what the US track record shows.

events.title: Arsenal vs Liverpool: Premier League – team news, start time, lineups
events.description: Arsenal finished last term as runners up in the EPL to Liverpool, but now lead the way as the holders toil this term.

events.title: Yemen’s separatist leader feared being “possibly imprisoned” in Riyadh
events.description: “They[STC] basically said, Aidarous [al-Zubaidi] feared that if he's going to go to Riyadh..."

events.title: Peace as policy: Mediation is the core sense of modern diplomacy
events.description: Norway and Qatar have made mediation not an instrument of goodwill but a core instrument of security policy.

events.title: Everything you need to know about the Syria – Israel deal in Paris
events.description: Syria and Israel agreed to form a joint mechanism aimed at sharing intelligence and military deescalation.

events.title: Who is Diosdado Cabello, Maduro’s interior minister and militia boss?
events.description: Cabello, who rose to power under Hugo Chavez, has been accused by a UN rights mission of cracking down on dissent.

events.title: Who is Aidarous al-Zubaidi? Yemen’s ‘traitor’ chief
events.description: From governor to fugitive: Who is al-Zubaidi, the southern leader accused of 'high treason' in Yemen?

events.title: Why do 250 million Christians celebrate Christmas on January 7?
events.description: Orthodox and Coptic Christians don’t believe Jesus was born on a different day; they just use a different calendar.

events.title: Markets digest bank earnings after recent turmoil
events.description: No description available.

events.title: Still haven't filed your taxes? Here's what you need to know
events.description: So far this tax season, the IRS has received more than 90 million income tax returns for 2022.

events.title: Analysis: Fox News is about to enter the true No Spin Zone
events.description: This is it.

events.title: Scientists identify secret ingredient in Leonardo da Vinci paintings
events.description: "Old Masters" such as Leonardo da Vinci, Sandro Botticelli and Rembrandt may have used proteins, especially egg yolk, in their oil paintings, according to a new study.

events.title: 'A definitive backslide.' Inside fashion's worrying runway trend
events.description: Now that the Fall-Winter 2023 catwalks have been disassembled, it's clear one trend was more pervasive than any collective penchant for ruffles, pleated skirts or tailored coats.

events.title: Michael Jordan's 1998 NBA Finals sneakers sell for a record $2.2 million
events.description: In 1998, Michael Jordan laced up a pair of his iconic black and red Air Jordan 13s to bring home a Bulls victory during Game 2 of his final NBA championship — and now they are the most expensive sneakers ever to sell at auction. The game-winning sneakers sold for $2.2 million at Sotheby's in New York on Tuesday, smashing the sneaker auction record of $1.47 million, set in 2021 by a pair of Nike Air Ships that Jordan wore earlier in his career.

events.title: Here's the real reason to turn on airplane mode when you fly
events.description: We all know the routine by heart: "Please ensure your seats are in the upright position, tray tables stowed, window shades are up, laptops are stored in the overhead bins and electronic devices are set to flight mode."

events.title: 'I was up to my waist down a hippo's throat.' He survived, and here's his advice
events.description: Paul Templer was living his best life.

events.title: Relaxed entry rules make it easier than ever to visit this stunning Asian nation
events.description: Due to its remoteness and short summer season, Mongolia has long been a destination overlooked by travelers.

events.title: The most beautiful sections of China's Great Wall
events.description: Having lived in Beijing for almost 12 years, I've had plenty of time to travel widely in China.

events.title: Sign up to our newsletter for a weekly roundup of travel news
events.description: No description available.

events.title: Democrats decry Trump’s Venezuela operation while Republicans praise ‘outstanding’ effort after classified briefing – live
events.description: Senators hear briefing from Marco Rubio and Pete Hegseth; Chuck Schumer says ‘the public needs answers’ after what Democrats describe as an unsatisfactory meeting Miranda Bryant , the Guardian’s Nordic correspondent, also has written this handy explainer on why Donald Trump is renewing calls for a takeover of Greenland : Continue reading...

events.title: 'Tuna King' pays record £2.4m for giant bluefin at Tokyo auction
events.description: Kiyoshi Kimura will turn prized 243kg fish into sushi rolls selling for £2.4o at his restaurant chain A sushi entrepreneur has paid a record 510.3m yen (£2.4m) for a giant bluefin tuna at a prestigious auction in Tokyo’s main fish market. Kiyoshi Kimura, who styles himself the “Tuna King”, paid the top price for the 243kg (536lbs) specimen, which was caught off Japan’s northern coast. Continue reading...

events.title: U.S. seizes Russian-flagged oil tanker with ties to Venezuela
events.description: U.S. forces have seized a Russian-flagged oil tanker in the north Atlantic after a two week chase. This is part of the larger U.S. campaign aimed at tankers going to and from Venezuela.

events.title: GOP gearing up to face tough midterms. And, Pentagon reviews women in ground combat
events.description: Trump offers advice to the GOP as midterm fears grow and he struggles to connect with voters on the economy. And, the Pentagon reviews the "effectiveness" of women in ground combat roles.

events.title: Hungarian filmmaker Béla Tarr — known for bleak, existential movies — has died
events.description: Tarr's films were long, dark, and often abstract explorations of everyday life and politics.

events.title: Lawmakers split over Maduro's seizure. And, CDC cuts childhood vaccine schedule
events.description: Ousted Venezuelan leader Nicolás Maduro and his wife pleaded not guilty in New York yesterday. And, the CDC scales back routine childhood vaccine recommendations at President Trump's direction.

events.title: The criminal prosecution of Nicolás Maduro is underway. Here's what to expect
events.description: Now begins what could be a lengthy legal process of pretrial motions, potential plea negotiations and possibly a jury trial of the authoritarian leader who ruled Venezuela for more than a decade.

events.title: Ski jumping: 'Are they trying to pull a fast one on us?'
events.description: Domen Prevc has followed in his brother's footsteps by winning the Four Hills Tournament. However, more than the Slovenian's achievement, this year's edition may be remembered for less pleasant reasons.

events.title: Venezuela: US forces say they seized a second oil tanker
events.description: In back-to-back operations, the US says it seized a Russian-flagged oil tanker in the North Atlantic and another in the Caribbean, linked to Venezuelan oil. Follow DW for more.

events.title: Venezuela: Trump's $3 billion oil windfall — why it matters
events.description: US President Donald Trump has announced an agreement with Venezuela's interim government to transfer millions of barrels of oil to the US. DW explores how the plan could be a blow to China, Russia, Iran and Cuba.

events.title: Ukraine updates: Zelenskyy in Cyprus as EU presidency begins
events.description: Volodymyr Zelenskyy is in Nicosia, while Ukrainian and US negotiators remain in Paris, looking to iron out more details of Tuesday's "robust" security guarantees agreement. Meanwhile, the fighting continues. DW has more.

events.title: How clean energy could save us trillions
events.description: As clean energy prices fall, a fast transition to renewable energy is the cheapest option on the table. Experts say it could save us trillions in energy costs alone.

events.title: Who is the Trump administration architect, Stephen Miller?
events.description: The U.S. government should be conducting itself with "Strength. Force. And Power" according to senior White House aide Stephen Miller.The deputy chief of staff for policy is part of Trump's inner circle, oversees a staff of forty people and is the homeland security advisor. He has long pushed hard-right domestic policies such as mass deportations and more recently has set his sights to overseas territories. Who is Stephen Miller and how did he rise to such a prominent position?

events.title: French film show: 'Furcy' revisits dark chapter of slavery in France
events.description: We take a look at the French films kicking off 2026, as Manon Kerjean tells us about 'Furcy', the true story of a slave living on Reunion Island in the early 19th century who discovers that he was, in fact, born free. We also discuss the moving family drama "The Wonderers" and hear from début director Joséphine Japy about bringing her personal experience to the film.

events.title: US military seizes Russian-flagged oil tanker in North Atlantic
events.description: The US on Wednesday seized a Russian oil tanker in the North Atlantic that officials said was part of a shadow fleet carrying oil in violation of US sanctions. The US military had pursued the Marinera tanker, formerly named the Bella-1, from the coast of Venezuela, capturing it shortly before seizing a second sanctioned tanker in the Caribbean.

events.title: What we know about tankers seized by US - as Russia responds
events.description: America has seized two sanctioned oil tankers linked to Venezuela in back-to-back operations in the North Atlantic and the Caribbean.

events.title: Trump announces US to be given 'high quality' oil by Venezuela
events.description: Donald Trump has announced Venezuela's interim government will be "turning over" between 30 and 50 million barrels of "high quality" oil to the US.

events.title: Who will join the UK and France in sending peacekeeping troops to Ukraine?
events.description: The UK and France have pledged to deploy peacekeeping troops in Ukraine in the event of a peace deal.

events.title: Funeral held for French movie and style icon Brigitte Bardot
events.description: Brigitte Bardot's funeral has been held with a private service in Saint-Tropez.

events.title: Pope closes 2025 Holy Year and signals his pontificate can now begin in earnest
events.description: Pope Leo XIV has closed the Vatican’s 2025 Holy Year, denouncing consumerism and anti-foreigner sentiment

events.title: Iran executes a man convicted of spying for Israel's Mossad
events.description: Iran has executed a man convicted of spying for Israeli Mossad

events.title: European leaders push back on Trump's comments about a US takeover of Greenland
events.description: Several European leaders have pushed back on U.S. President Donald Trump’s comments seeking an American takeover of Greenland

events.title: Progress for Ukraine talks in Paris is uncertain with US focus on Venezuela and Greenland tension
events.description: Ukraine's allies are meeting in Paris to discuss security guarantees after any potential peace deal with Russia

events.title: Trump leaves Venezuela's opposition sidelined and Maduro's party in power
events.description: Opposition supporters have long hoped their leaders could replace Nicolás Maduro as Venezuela's president

events.title: Provisional election results show Central Africa Republic President Faustin Archange Touadéra won a third term
events.description: Provisional election results show Central Africa Republic President Faustin Archange Touadéra won a third term

events.title: Indonesia's panda cub Rio thriving 40 days after birth
events.description: Indonesia’s conservation park has shared a video of a giant panda cub named Rio, 40 days after his birth

events.title: Slovenia will hold parliamentary election on March 22
events.description: Slovenia's president has set a parliamentary election for March 22

events.title: Central African Republic President Faustin Archange Touadéra reelected, provisional results show
events.description: Provisional results have shown Central African Republic President Faustin Archange Touadéra won a third term in last month’s election

events.title: Gaza: 100 per cent of basic food needs met for first time since 2023
events.description: For the first time since 2023, humanitarian assistance will provide Gazans with enough food to fulfil minimum nutritional needs.

events.title: Chicago teacher disappears, husband pleads for help finding her
events.description: Chicago teacher Linda Brown, 53, vanished Saturday after leaving for acupuncture appointment. Her family is desperately searching for answers.

events.title: Congress holds hearing into Minnesota fraud allegations and more top headlines
events.description: Get all the stories you need-to-know from the most powerful name in news delivered first thing every morning to your inbox.

events.title: Michael Reagan, elder son of former President Ronald Reagan, dies at 80
events.description: Conservative author and radio host Michael Reagan, who promoted his father Ronald Reagan's legacy through the Reagan Foundation, has died at age 80.

events.title: Harvard dean removed after anti-White, anti-police social media posts resurfaced
events.description: Gregory Davis, former Harvard Dunster House dean, no longer serves in role following revelation of posts calling police "racist and evil" and defending looting as democracy.

events.title: US military seizes two sanctioned tankers in Atlantic Ocean
events.description: U.S. forces seized the Russian-flagged oil tanker in dramatic North Atlantic operation targeting sanctioned Venezuelan oil shipments.

events.title: Maduro's son gives 'unconditional support' to newly sworn in interim Venezuela president
events.description: Nicolás Maduro's son pledges continued support to interim President Delcy Rodríguez after his father's capture by U.S. forces and extradition to New York.

events.title: Nobel Peace Prize recipient Machado pledges to return to Venezuela, sees 'alarming' internal crackdown
events.description: Venezuelan opposition leader Maria Corina Machado vows to return home as regime allegedly escalates widespread crackdown on dissent and journalists.
